intro: Malvastrum nototrichoides, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces fluffy, cotton-like seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It thrives in wet, swampy areas and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, but it can also become invasive in certain environments.
